page.title: 04ST.JOHN'S CHURCH PEMBERTON
page.content:
The church was built in 1835 with funds allocated by the government.It was one of many churches built around that time to celebrate the British victory over Napoleon.The church was built to serve a rapidly growing Pemberton district.
The gravestones in the cemetery provide evidence of contemporary social conditions.For example,there are graves belonging to children who died of Typhoid,Smallpox and Diptheria.There are also graves of miners killed at work which illustrate both the dangerous nature of the job at that time and the connection of the area with coal.
